titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2289) to reauthorize the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, to better protect futures customers, to provide end-users with market certainty, to make basic reforms to ensure transparency and accountability at the Commission, to help farmers, ranchers, and end-users manage risks, to help keep consumer costs low, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-136, by Mr. Newhouse.

Resolution provides authority for the Committee on Appropriations to have until 5 p.m. Friday, June 5, 2015, to file privileged reports to accompany measures making appropriations for the fiscal year ending Sept. 30, 2016.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 37.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 288.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 182 (Roll no. 274).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/2/2015--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2289) to reauthorize the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, to better protect futures customers, to provide end-users with market certainty, to make basic reforms to ensure transparency and accountability at the Commission, to help farmers, ranchers, and end-users manage risks, to help keep consumer costs low.
